metadata.title: CVE-2021-34798 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Malformed requests may cause the server to dereference a NULL pointer. Thisissue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.48 and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-bin - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-data - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
apache2-utils - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.48-3.1ubuntu2').
